theme.title: Counter-time (off-beat notes)
theme.para: The off-beat syncopation commonly refers to rhythms that emphasize the weak beats of a measure.

In this lesson we are going to practise the occasional short-term displacement of accent that is produced by moving a note to a weak part but without continuing it to the next beat, and preceding it by a rest on the strong part. The rest reinforces the accent on the weak part.
